p: In the case of black cumin seed oil ( Figure 1A), the addition of sage and basil lowered the level of tocopherols compared to the control (oil without additives), except for the addition of 100 g of intact plants (IP) and in case of basil also 100 g of leaves (L). The addition of thyme did not affect tocopherols in black cumin seed oil, except for the addition of 50 g of leaves (L) and 50 g of intact plants (IP), which caused a decrease in total tocopherols by about 20% ( Figure 1A).
